Citation.sTitle: Heat Capacities of Uracil, Thymine, and Its Alkylated, Cyclooligomethylenated, and Halogenated Derivatives by Differential Calorimetry
Citation.sAbstract: The molar heat capacity (Cp) of solid uracil, its alkylated and halogenated derivatives, and cyclooligomethylenouracils in the temperature range of (298.15 to 343.15) K by a differential scanning calorimeter (SETARAM TG-DSC 111) were determined. It was demonstrated that the Cp value increases by increasing the number of methylene groups attached to the diketopyrimidine ring. The correlations Cp ) f(T) are given. The contributions of C-CH3, N-CH3, and C-NO2 groups as well as F, Cl, Br, and I atoms in the value of Cp for the temperature of 298.15 K are presented. The Chickos method for calculation of Cp values is discussed.
